intro: Allophylus sumatranus, commonly known as the Sumatran alder, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Allophylus sumatranus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native range.
